tags.title: Learning Objective
value: Explain the causes and effects of the ideological struggle of the Cold War.
Compare the ways in which the United States and the Soviet Union sought to maintain influence over the course of the Cold War.
Explain how and why globalization changed culture over time.
Explain the causes and effects of environmental changes in the period from 1900 to present.

tags.title: Thematic Focus
value: A variety of internal and external factors contribute to state formation, expansion, and decline. Governments maintain order through a variety of administrative institutions, policies, and procedures, and governments obtain, retain, and exercise power in

The process by which societies group their members, and the norms that govern the interactions between these groups and between individuals, influence political, economic, and cultural institutions and organization.
The environment shapes human societies, and as populations grow and change, these populations in turn shape their environments.

tags.title: Historical Development
value: The global balance of economic and political power shifted during and after World War II and rapidly evolved into the Cold War. The democracy of the United States and the authoritarian communist Soviet Union emerged as superpowers, which led to ideologica
Groups and individuals including the Non-Aligned Movement, opposed and promoted alternatives to the existing economic, political, and social orders.

The Cold War produced new military alliances, including NATO and the Warsaw Pact, and led to nuclear proliferation and proxy wars between and within postcolonial states in Latin America, Africa, and Asia.

As human activity contributed to deforestation, desertification, a decline in air quality, and increased consumption of the world's supply of fresh water, humans competed over these and other resources more intensely than ever before.
Political and social changes of the 20th century led to changes in the arts and in the second half of the century, popular and consumer culture became more global.
